meanings.definition: Phenoms: A person of outstanding abilities or qualities.
meanings.sent1: She is a phenoms in the world of music, known for her incredible voice.
meanings.sent2: The young soccer player is considered a phenoms for his exceptional skills on the field.
meanings.sent3: The phenoms of the classroom, Sarah always impresses her classmates with her intelligence.
meanings.sent4: His talent on the guitar makes him a phenoms among musicians, standing out with his unique style.
meanings.sent5: The phenoms of the art world, her paintings leave everyone in awe of her talent.

meanings.definition: Phenoms: An outstanding event or occurrence.
meanings.sent1: The meteor shower was a rare phenoms that amazed everyone who witnessed it.
meanings.sent2: The championship game turned out to be a phenoms, with unexpected twists and turns.
meanings.sent3: The sudden appearance of a rainbow during the storm was a delightful phenoms.
meanings.sent4: The grand fireworks display was a phenoms in the night sky, lighting up the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The blooming of the rare flower was a natural phenoms, attracting botanists from far and wide.
